Package model

Class WordleModel

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
model.WordleModel
public class WordleModel extends Observable
This class represents the model of Wordle. It stores each of the user's guesses, and keeps track of which characters have been correctly guessed, incorrectly guessed and which crackers are correctly guessed but in the incorrect positions.
Author:
Leighanna Pipatanangkura

      public WordleModel() throws IOException

  • Method Details

    • makeGuess

      public void makeGuess(int guessNumber, String guess)
      Updates the guessed characters array with whether or not at the index the character appears in the alphabet. If the character has not been guessed yet, the corresponding index will be null.
      Parameters:
      guess - The user's guess passed in as a string.

    • getAnswer

      public String getAnswer()
      Returns the answer to win the game.
      Returns:
      the hidden word.

    • getGuessedCharacters

      public INDEX_RESULT[] getGuessedCharacters()
      Returns an array of characters that corresponds to what the user has guess and have not guessed. Where null will represent what the user has not guessed, and the actual character for what the user has already guessed all corresponding to the indices they appear in the alphabet.
      Returns:
      the character array that represents the letters the user

    • getProgress

      public Guess[] getProgress()
      Returns the user's progress.
      Returns:
      a array of guesses that represents the progress the user has made through out the game.

    • setAnswer

      private void setAnswer()
      At the beginning of the game, this sets the word that needs to be guessed.

    • inDictionary

      private boolean inDictionary(String guess)
      Returns true of the user's guess exists in the dictionary. and false if the guess does not.
      Parameters:
      guess - the user's guess passed in as a string.
      Returns:
      A boolean to see if the dictionary contains the user's guess.

    • createDictionary

      private void createDictionary() throws IOException
      Creates the dictionary that this game is going to use. The dictionary contains all of the words that is available for the user to guess and the hidden word.
      Throws:
      IOException - thrown if the "Dictionary.txt" is not found.
